sn40.9:1.1: “They speak of this thing called the ‘signless immersion of the heart’.
sn40.9:1.2: What is the signless immersion of the heart?
sn40.9:1.4: ‘It’s when a mendicant, not focusing on any signs, enters and remains in the signless immersion of the heart.
sn40.9:1.5: This is called the signless immersion of the heart.’
sn40.9:1.6: And so … I was entering and remaining in the signless immersion of the heart.
sn40.9:1.7: While I was in that meditation, my consciousness followed after signs.
sn40.9:2.1: Then the Buddha came up to me with his psychic power and said,
sn40.9:2.3: Don’t neglect the signless immersion of the heart, brahmin! Settle your mind in the signless immersion of the heart; unify your mind and immerse it in the signless immersion of the heart.’
sn40.9:2.4: And so, after some time … I entered and remained in the signless immersion of the heart.
sn40.9:2.5: So if anyone should be rightly called
sn40.9:2.6: a disciple who attained to great direct knowledge with help from the Teacher, it’s me.”
